website_summaries.verdict: A scale that can handle a lot of weight and also has a lifting side to make it easier to weigh envelopes or tubes.
pros: Can handle weight up to 110 lbs
Shows real time increases in weight
Display has a long cord for use with larger items
Scale is lightweight and easily portable
cons: This scale has an automatic shutoff and takes a while to restart, which could be frustrating if you weigh a lot of packages

customer_reviews.title: Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS. If there is a positive review on here it’s most likely not real. This product is a total scam. Does not do what it says it’s meant to do. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: BlueOriginRocks

customer_reviews.title: unit failed within 45 days of purchase
customer_reviews.text: initially, i really liked this scale. was very accurate and did exactly what i needed. never a discrepancywith the post office scales. then the meter stated to float a bit, would not stay at zero when not loaded. tried to calibrate but problem just has continued to get worse. zeroed the scale 5 minutes ago and now it reads 1 lb. 12.9 oz. and is climbing. can't be trusted anymore, waste of money. will try another brand and hope for the best.
customer_reviews.author: jeff k

customer_reviews.title: Numbers jump all over the place
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Portable and lightweight . doesn't take much space. I like that the weight display is separated from the scale platform. Con: After using it probably 3 times, the numbers keep going crazy and jumping all aver the place whether there is item on it or not. I carefully follow to instructions to recalibrate it but it still goes crazy. It is now useless since numbers are not accurate. I am now trying to find something better so I can resort to printing my shipping label from home . The return window has closed and I can't return it I hope I was only unlucky and purchased a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: Clemence Dieudonne

customer_reviews.title: Works great with one annoyance
customer_reviews.text: The scale seems to be accurate and reliable and that's the end of the story for most people. However, I am really annoyed that the screen read-out times out after a minute or two. I wish it would stay on until I turn it off. If I forget to turn it off and my batteries die, that's my fault and I'll deal with the consequences. Pros - accurate - easy to use - easy to read - multiple measurement standards - reliable Cons - screen time-out - cable can be annoying (but is necessary if your package is very wide)
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Great value and quality, pretty accurate, but I wish their interconnecting cords were a bit better quality. They are a bit stiff and you can't keep moving the display around as you might need, because if the cord gets trained in one position, it will force the light display to go where it wants, or even flip it . Secondly, the display is pretty dim and hard to see. Dim blue on black background LCD with a narrow viewing angle. Other than that, it is practical and it's hard to beat the value.
customer_reviews.author: Leo M

customer_reviews.title: It stands up to heavy use and is pretty accurate
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for almost a year and it's still on it's first set of batteries. It's off by about .5oz either way compared to the post office so I just round up 1oz on shipping labels. ex. 14.7oz on this will sometimes be 15.2oz at the post office or 14.5oz depending on the day. Either way, it still works and is good enough. For something that measures up to 110lbs it's pretty dang accurate, especially considering that I can check 3oz packages on it. I was buying a new scale every couple of months before this one, it's the only scale that has lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioning in less than a year, used 3 times
customer_reviews.text: My scale worked great 3 times. I have changed to fresh batteries and it will weigh nothing with the weight fluctuating up and down with nothing touching the scale and even with the scale empty. I didn't believe the other negative reviews but they are true. After using 3 times it no longer works with batteries or plugged in. I feel ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Scale
customer_reviews.text: It works for me and my small business. I send small envelopes and small boxes through USPS. As you can tell by the video the reading shifts a little bit, but not a significant jump. Please read the directions for all button functions as I did not prior to recording this video. After the video was created, I decided to change out the accuracy of the reading with batteries only. After zeroing out the scale, the weight was about the same. I stand firm on rounding the nearest whole number. Best
customer_reviews.author: Callie Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Good for 5 years
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for 5 years and until now it's been great. Easy to ready and very accurate. However, in the last few months the display has been flaky, sometimes not working until to tap it several time. Also, the accuracy is not consistent, I've had several packages adjusted by USPS and UPS for weights not being correct. Considering it's age, I can't complain too much, I've gotten my money's worth for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: If you're in need of a random number generator, buy this scale! Not accurate at all, and quits working in about a year.
customer_reviews.text: Never seems to "settle" on a final number after an item has been placed on it - a clear sign of a poorly engineered scale with an inaccurate DAC. After a year of it mostly sitting in a drawer and pulling it out for a few more measurements, it seem to no longer work at all (just says "0.00"). Changed the batteries, tried connecting/disconnecting the cable from the display to the scale, all to no avail. If you're in need of a random number generator, buy this scale!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Many uses
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scale with the only intention of weighing packages. I was mistaken to think a scale would weigh things, it didn’t work out of the box, I watched videos read feedback and what other small amount of information I could find on this model. I does have some potential as a doorstop, or a paperweight, maybe a wheel chock to stop a car from rolling. But for finding out what something weighs, it won’t work. A complete waste of time and money, I feel bad for the guy that delivered it, it was a waste of his time too. Maybe I’ll set it on top of my mailbox and hope somebody steals it.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Five year anniversary review
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scale back in 2015. It works perfectly for all intended purposes. I mainly use it to weigh the items that I sell on eBay to calculate the postage. Every once in a while I compare my measurement with the one in the post office - it is always spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: Great for moderate use, wears out with heavy use though.
customer_reviews.text: I use this scale everyday for shipping and while its great for about 3 months, after that I notice it will occasionally wig out and start adding grams or subtracting them. If I take the batteries out I can usually reset it and it will work properly. This is my second (last one was in red though) purchase of this exact model and both times the same thing happened. UPDATE: This one has failed me, too. My life expectancy on these with daily use is about 9 months to a year.
customer_reviews.author: Karisa

customer_reviews.title: Makes Shipping Much Easier
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Accuteck ShipPro because I had been trying to weigh packages on my kitchen scale. That worked except when I had large packages that blocked the display. After some research on brands and models, I decided on this one. There are definitely others out there that are better but they are also more expensive. Unless you're running a warehouse and sending multiple large packages out everyday, this is the perfect little scale. It doesn't take up a lot of room, it's easy to use, accurate, inexpensive and the display is easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Coolmommy

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate and stops working in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: We ordered one of these on 12/11/18. On 2/6/19, the numbers began jumping around and gradually increasing, up to several pounds, with no weight on the unit. Amazon provided a replacement, which began having the same jumping around issue on 9/2/19. It then would show the startup process (all icons/numbers/etc. lit) for up to five minutes before being "usable", with numbers jumping around. Meanwhile, throughout it's use over those few months, our package weights were often less than what the UPS drop offs weighed our packages in at. Attempting to find a manufacturer, website, or anything to contact for warranty was impossible. Amazon also could not find any information, and finally ended up refunding our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Battery Use Stopped Working After 6 Months
customer_reviews.text: The batteries that come with the scale are from China. They are slightly thinner than AAA batteries you buy in the USA. When the batteries died and I tried to change them, they don't work. They are too tight to fit in the compartment. If you shove them in they still don't hit the contact points correctly in order to give a charge. Super frustrating as now I have to plug in the scale every time to use it. I love this scale and had researched several before buying it and it is accurate but total bummer on the batter situation. I wish the company would send me new batteries but I can't find a way to contact them.
customer_reviews.author: Kauai Mom

customer_reviews.title: Helps for click and ship
customer_reviews.text: It works. It weighs my boxes the way it should so I can Click and Ship with the USPS. Because the readout is on a cord and not on the actual scale itself you can easily see the readings when there is a large box on the scale. You can switch between pounds/ounces and kilograms. It says the max weight is 110 lbs, but I have yet to try it for boxes that heavy. The surface area of the scale itself is pretty small, so if you have a large box you may have to place a stable, stiff platform on it and zero out the scale before actually weighing the box.
customer_reviews.author: D. C.

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: This scale was bought in January of 2015 and now it's totally dead, will not turn for over a week. It was blinking on and off since I got it. It would light up sometimes, then sometimes it wouldn't but I would plug out then back in again. Then it finally died and it's too late to return. Do not buy this scale if you are looking to have it on three months. Also it is very small and a larger box can hardly hold on it. Not a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Stuff2go

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd never purchased this scale.
customer_reviews.text: I sell online and rely on an accurate read on my packages. I have a scale from Stamps.Com that's always on point but I needed a second scale because I travel between to homes. This scale hasn't been accurate at all. In free even had packages come back for additional postage. Ive tested it with the batteries and plugged in without the batteries but it's still an inconsistent read and I can't afford to lose money because of it. Very disappointed with this scale.
customer_reviews.author: AlisaD

customer_reviews.title: Great Size and Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I have a horrible history with getting shipping charges completely wrong when mailing out packages. I prepay postage and go to the post office, just to have to pay extra. I needed something light weight, accurate, and easy to read. I researched several scales in my price range. This seemed to be what I was looking for. Out of the box, it was ready to use. Very easy to setup and came with batteries for the display, which I like is not on the scale itself (better to read for larger packages). I was ready to go immediately. I went to the post office with 2 packages to double check my weight and both were spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally got my scale replaced !!
customer_reviews.text: My scale broke after two years, and I read it has a 10 year warranty. This would be great if they actually had a phone line. There is no one to contact so if you are interested in buying this scale, buyer beware! Update:: I found out that the seller is backing the warranty for the scale and if you contact them instead of the manufacturer. They will answer and send you a new scale as long as you tell them what happened. Something I would not have expected. I’ve only had it for two years but they still did replace it.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: As a small business who ships a lot of packages from home, this scale is AMAZING!!! Why have I not thought of getting one sooner!!?? I've been using the flimsy scale that came directly from USPS for the past four years. THIS scale is SUPER accurate, it's just as small for easy storing but what I love most is that I don't have to try to peek under a big box to actually see the display! I LOVE the detached display!!! This was my best Amazon purchase all month! (and that's saying A LOT!!)
customer_reviews.author: Riz'n Star

customer_reviews.title: Shipping made easy...hopefully.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I've only tested it right out the box and it was pretty easy and straight forward. It came with batteries which I didn't realize which was nice and the instructions are super easy to read and follow. I probably won't be shipping anything that weighs anything close to 110lbs, but it's nice to have the option. Once I start using it for real shipping will be the real test, but so far I am super happy with it. I will update my review once I use it a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Danyelle

customer_reviews.title: Money and Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: I've been running a side business, buying and selling antiques from my home for a couple of months now. A friend suggested that I start doing my own postage at home to save money and they were right. I can't believe how much I was paying to ship stuff before, most times at a loss. This scale allows me to have the information that I need to print my own labels at home and now I am literally saving anywhere from 30-40% in shipping costs as a result. This scale is accurate enough to do the job and it's been doing great so far.
customer_reviews.author: W. K. Joyner

customer_reviews.title: Bright and Accurate!
customer_reviews.text: Price was great on this! I've used it a couple of time already to ship packages and the weight is accurate. I've been using mine on AC power, which works well. I'm sure the AAA batteries work just the same, but I'm not sure how long the life would be. I like the digital display - it's very bright and far enough away from the scale to accommodate large packages. It will work great for weighing my luggage before I travel too - those airline desk agents are noobs about the luggage weight - not that you can argue about it, but you won't be surprised by the weight at least.
customer_reviews.author: BossLady

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!  Extremely Accurate!  Owned for 3.5 years and still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scale over 3 1/2 years ago, and it is still going strong. We use it daily for to weigh the packages we ship for our ebay business. If you are looking for a postal scale, look no further, this is it. Occasionally I will check this scale's measurement against what is measured for the same package at the post office on the USPS scales. It is always spot on. This saves us a lot of money, as for example, if the scale says a package is 15.9 oz, I know I can ship first class (cheapest shipping) as I trust the post office won't say the package is over a pound.
customer_reviews.author: RSS

customer_reviews.title: Size stated completely wrong.  BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: Size stated in this ad stated it is 8x10x3. Actual size is 6 3/4x8x1 1/2. It is completely useless. Ts no way you can fit any box of books on the surface to weigh. If you flip open both sides or "wings" (see their pics, the size of surface gets even smaller; 6 3/4 x 6 3/4. It might measure 110 lbs. but I can't think of a thing we would ship that would fit on this scale. Who measured this thing for your ad? This will be going back for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Redsender

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read, even for large packages
customer_reviews.text: This scale has been fantastic for large packages. I can place them on the weigh pan and still see the weight by moving the readout further away. It has handled heavy weights just fine and has displayed great accuracy thus far--I've used it for a year and a half.
customer_reviews.author: L.White Creative

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the online seller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a scale that wound up costing me money in underpaid postage. This scale is very accurate - I have weighed, paid for postage for a sold product, taken it to the local Post Office where the weight was correctly verified. Having the control and readout screen separate from the scale is essential for weighing an item that hangs over the scale. A real no-brainer to use. I wish this had been my first scale!
customer_reviews.author: Teri A. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy is Spot On!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had these scales for a few days so I don't know how they will perform over time. Right now, they match the weight on UPS scales so I would say that is pretty accurate. Having the digital display for the weight on a separate piece of equipment is a big plus. It means you can sit your package on the scales and quickly and easily see the numbers. Speaking of numbers, the display's digital readout is fabulous with the height of the numbers being between 3/4" and 1" tall. I also like the tare function which makes estimating weight of a larger shipment easier to calculate. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Accurate postage scale
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this scale. It seems to be really accurate (I have asked post office to double check some packages from time to time to make sure of the accuracy) and their weight matches mine. It has made shipping products more convenient by allowing me to purchase postage at home for packages and then being able to just drop the package off at the post office. It has also helped me save money but purchasing discounted postage on line. The scale display is back lit which comes in handy in low light situations. It will also shut off after a little bit of inactivity to conserve the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Landlord

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2, neither worked
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first scale about 2 months ago. The scale did not work as the LED wold not not work with batteries. Due to Coronavirus, I did not go to the UPS store to return it. I received my second scale this morning. The power button on the LED part was apparently not installed properly. It is permanently stuck in the down position, and wold not "click". I attempted to pry it up with a small knife to no avail. The bottom line is that I purchased two scales, and neither of them worked. Unfortunately, Amazon only allows me to give a low score of 1. A scale that doesn't function deserves a 0
customer_reviews.author: Camp Man

customer_reviews.title: Extremely small
customer_reviews.text: This item looks like it is big enough to weigh boxes when you look at the picture(s). It is not. It is barely big enough to place a cereal bowl on it. The surface to weigh the items being shipped is tiny. When it arrived we laughed at how small it was. Make sure if you buy this for weighing boxes you plan to ship that you be prepared for how small the boxes will need to be. 90% of your boxes will be to big for this scale.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I brought this to weigh items for shipping. I had 2 items to go ship and both the weights were off. One package the scale showed as 12oz. ( I knew this was wrong) and when I went to the post office it weighed at 1 lb. 7 oz. The other the scale showed as 1.7 oz and the post office showed as 3.4 oz.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Accuteck ShipPro 110lbs x 0.1 oz. Digital Shipping Postal Scale, Black (W-8580-110-Black)
customer_reviews.text: Accuteck ShipPro 110lbs x 0.1 oz. Digital Shipping Postal Scale, Black (W-8580-110-Black), love it, I watched a YouTube video to set it up, there are tons! I use this for online selling made easy! Shipping is where I made big mistakes but Not any Longer! This machine is accurate and great for weighing bigger items that weigh more. © 2020
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Paulson

customer_reviews.title: Have to re-zero the scale each time I use it
customer_reviews.text: I use this scale for shipping. I was using a different Accuteck scale that did not have the remote display. I had problems reading the weight of larger boxes. This scale does not have that problem as I can set the display remote from the weigh platform. The only issue I have, is that I have to re zero the scale after weighing just a couple of boxes. It does not seem to want to stay at zero.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Holt

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap scale
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this scale does a great job. I really like the fact it runs off of batteries as well as the wall outlet. Most of the time I just use the battery option as it allows me to be mobile with it. My only problem with it is, heavier and bigger items have to be centered well on it to get an accurate reading.
customer_reviews.author: Tony S

customer_reviews.title: I have a small digital scale, but is fragile ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a small digital scale, but is fragile and its range was limited. My wife has begun her ebay career, and needed an accurate scale which would measure weight ranging from less than an ounce to over 100lb. This scale fits the bill, and she loves it !! The manufacturer says the scale can measure up to 170 lb...have never tried that, but did weigh a few objects over 30 lb, and this scale matched the scale at the post office EXACTLY. The scale is small enough to fit in a desk drawer, and the fold out upright sides corral those objects that are hard to contain,
customer_reviews.author: Joe Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it
customer_reviews.text: So dissapointed. Worked perfectly fine at first then stopped functioning after about 7 months. I'm unable to use it now. Turned the scale on and the numbers are jumping all over the place like its possessed. Yes, I read the instructions and know how to clear it. Took the batteries out, replaced the batteries and then tested all the different weight variations. Still doesnt work. In a nutshell, its cheaply made and unreliable after 6-8 months. Avoid this scale and pay a little more for one you wont have to replace twice a year.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great Until It Didn’t
customer_reviews.text: Great product, until it wasn’t. Used for light weight shipping, most packages under 3lbs but it accommodates those that maxed out at 40. We have used it for about a year. Given our sales, it actually weighed about 500 items in total. Then just decided to stop working. It’s been well treated, kept indoors in the house, and no reason for it to totally fail. Now all it does is consistently scroll through weights, up and down, and won’t zero out. Would not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Darkwich

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: My nonprofit had to fulfill and order of 125 packages. We wanted to be able to print our own postage labels and schedule a pickup with the post office, but in order to do this, we needed to purchase a postal scale. This one was inexpensive and tiny. It won't take up much room at all to store. The display was easy to use. As far as accuracy, the order was shipped out with any issues. We didn't hear that the weights didn't match up with the scales at USPS.
customer_reviews.author: mjmiles

customer_reviews.title: Fits the Bill
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. The scale maintains its zero-tare calibration for your entire weighing session and consistently re-measures the 100 gm certified calibration weight that is recommended to be purchased with it, accurately. I use it for calculating postage for envelopes and packages. You will need to re-zero the scale each time you turn it on and before weighing items to be mailed/shipped but that is to be expected and does not take but a moment to do.
customer_reviews.author: U-Awtah Know

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first since reviews kinda went both ways.. but I needed something to help with my little boutique. I’d say it’s 99% accurate. I write down what it weighs compared to when it ships. I don’t think I’ve had but maybe an once less a couple times.? Although with its small scale (even though it has supported sides) I wish it were a little bigger! I feel that would solve the issue of things hanging over, (giving different weight). It’s also lightweight and easy to pack, if needed to travel with you! Overall though it’s been a complete life saver! Totally recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin N

customer_reviews.title: Was great at first, but disappointed now.
customer_reviews.text: This scale has been a great addition to the office. It's great for weighing shipping boxes but accurate enough for small letters and parcels as well. It set up very easily and included the batteries needed for disconnected use. The best part is that the display is not on the scale itself, so you can weigh bigger boxes without having to worry about covering it up. ** Edited Nov 2017 ** This scale started out great, but now fluctuates considerably. Can weigh the same item twice and get readings that are several ounces different. Pretty disappointed as it hasn't seen terribly heavy use :(
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Does not work. No customer service.
customer_reviews.text: The batteries fit very tightly. The first set worked fine for a few months, but when I had to change them, I could not get the scale to work with the new batteries. The batteries literally have to be shoved in and pried out. I’ve given up and have to use it plugged in. When I tried to call the customer service number regarding the warranty, I got a message that the number is disconnected. I cannot find a website or an alternative way to make contact. If anyone has any information or suggestions please let me know. EDIT 5/5/20: Scale no longer works. Numbers jump randomly.
customer_reviews.author: thriftykittyterrehaute

customer_reviews.title: Great little scale!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this scale! I got it knowing that many of the reviews that I saw said something to the effect of it breaking on them, but thought for the price, it's worth trying. I'm glad I did! I've had no problems with it in the 3 months I've been using it. It's easy to use and set up so I don't have to have a dedicated space for it - when I need it, I pull it out, set it up use it, and put it back. The time it takes for setting up is how long it takes to plug in a cord. Simple, simple.
customer_reviews.author: M. Knue

customer_reviews.title: The Best Scale for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: Accurate and digital with a good max capacity... what more could you want from a scale? It's compact, but not so small it's a pain. The extended display is helpful especially when weighing a larger box. I love that it can be battery operated or plugged in! I've used it in the kitchen at my cafe to weigh coffee, and I've used to weigh packages for shipping to customers. I've recommended to other business owners for all of the reasons above. This one is a no-brainer purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase With More Functions Than Needed
customer_reviews.text: Finally I can send packages and know what the weight is. I even weighed my luggage prior to a trip so I can attest to it working very well up to about 50 pounds. Over that I have not tried. I have not plugged it in, just use the batteries. I love that the screen has a long cord so I don't have to worry about seeing the weight under a portion of the box. It has tare if you need it as well as a hold function. If you're looking for a scale to weight boxes you ship or similar this one is going to do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: PBY

customer_reviews.title: It makes shipping easy...
customer_reviews.text: this has made my shipping process easy with savings. The accuracy is slight off but has saved me money once scaled in at USPS? Yes, the digital reading is clear and easy to read ...the highlighted LED numbers glow great in dimmed lighting. I also like the extended cord on the reader...and it holds/pause the weight amount on screen long enough for you to make note. The price is right for this postage equipment ...I recommend to ...
customer_reviews.author: Ladyda

customer_reviews.title: Quit working right after 4 uses..
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. I've only gotten to use it about 4 times and it has already stopped working correctly. As soon as its turned on it jumps around. It will not "zero" out. It jumps 40 grams up, then 60 down, then some up and down again. If you try to zero it out it immediately starts jumping again. I need PRECISE weights, and there is no way to get them with that item. Very disappointed, esp. after the many good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: L. Howard

customer_reviews.title: I see why this came highly recommended by so many of my reseller friends.
customer_reviews.text: As a reseller, I depend heavily on this scale. It gets a lot of daily use and has held up well after a few months of use. I like the design and I am extremely happy with my purchase. It turns on quick and no waiting to weigh my items. I also appreciate auto turn off. It holds a charge for a long time thru a ton of use. I can see why so many of my long time reseller friends highly recommend this scale.
customer_reviews.author: kbbels

customer_reviews.title: Y E S
customer_reviews.text: As most of you are probably using this for, a store.. it's great. Budget, weighs a whopping 110 pounds while only being about the size of a Cheeze-it box. I'm honestly impressed. It does take 4 AAA batteries to function on battery. But they're nice enough to include a semi-short ac adapter to power it constantly. Though getting a kit of rechargeable AAA batteries will solve this problem indefinitely as it does not drain power and shut off after not being used. Great product, weighs everything correctly and has enough functionality to keep me occupied, where I'm occupied. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Accuteck ShipPro Digital Shipping Postal Scale (W-8580-110-Black)
customer_reviews.text: I've used it sporadically for 3 weeks. Likes: Battery or USB powered. Display on long, coil cord. Easy to read display. Lightweight. Small. Dislikes: Some days it doesn't want to work regardless of resetting steps taken which is incredibly frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: LilSorceress

customer_reviews.title: Mandatory in any office
customer_reviews.text: We have one of these in every office. Handy, simple, and the fact that the control with the LCD is tethered with a long-enough coiled wire means you can put large items on the scale and still see the weight on the readout. The only annoying thing is that the battery compartment is super-right for standard alkaline AAAs. Seems like it was made for those very slightly smaller cheap "heavy-duty" batteries.
customer_reviews.author: conradb212

customer_reviews.title: Dim Blue Display, flimsy for 110 lbs max.
customer_reviews.text: The display is a backlit dim blue, useless in bright light and also has a narrow angle to view, good it is on a cord so you can grab it and tilt it. Kind of cheesy for a kind of expensive plastic scale. PS the 110 lbs would be a feat for a thin plastic scale with the small top.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Nohome

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Got this for selling on eBay. Every time I take a package to the post office it is within a 10th of an ounce of what their scales show. As an example my scale shows 10lbs 9.8oz, post office said 10lbs 9.7oz, I find this to be pretty accurate and always round up anyway. The remote reader has a long enough cord, very pleased with the whole thing and so much cheaper than buying one from an office store.
customer_reviews.author: ChadP

customer_reviews.title: Scale Broken After 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Great scale in theory, but I have had the scale for 2 months (just outside the return window) and it has already broken and will not accurately give weights for my items. The connection between the scale and the read-out screen appears to not send the correct information and the numbers just jump all over the place. This was happening ever-so-often, but finally, my scale just doesn't work. I haven't tried other scales but I'm just gonna pay more to get a better quality product.
customer_reviews.author: bds4513

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and Versatile.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful scale. Versatile and accurate. You can use batteries or plug it in. And the ability to lift up the sides to lean parcels against is surprisingly useful. On a cluttered table that helps keep large packages from being supported by items that are stationed around the scale. The accuracy is to 0.1 oz. I recently compared this scale's measurements to my local post office scale. Comparing seven packages, that weighed between 1 oz and 5 lb each. Of the seven items, this scale provided the exact same weight as the post office's scale for five of the packages. The two packages that weren't exactly the same weight differed from the Post Office's scale by 0.1 oz.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: It weighs my packages but not myself.
customer_reviews.text: A great digital scale that weighs packages heavier than I thought it would. It seems small and I though it would not be able to weigh the larger boxes I have but it does it well. Great value and an easy to read screen.
customer_reviews.author: GchanMako

customer_reviews.title: Very good little scale
customer_reviews.text: Very good scale that I use for shipping. The detached display makes my life much simpler as I can place odd or large shaped objects on scale and still see the readout. The battery/usb setup is very handy if I need to move the scale. I just wish it charged from the USB with a rechargeable battery. I like this scale so much that I purchased a second for another work area.
customer_reviews.author: Jrod

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the time or money spent
customer_reviews.text: Had this scale less than 60 days (48 to be exact) and today the button to change from Oz, LbOz, and Grams stopped working. The unit has received VERY light use as we’ve just got our fulfillment operation going last week, before that this unit hadn’t been used. I’m disappointed as I really like the remote display as we have small mailers and large boxes to weigh. We need to use Grams for international shipments and Lb Oz for US domestic shipments. I was super disappointed to see my Amazon return period had expires.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg - COO

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy it again!  Uses a lot of batteries, power doesn't work, not accurate!
customer_reviews.text: So first off, the triple AAA batteries do not fit properly, I have to force them in. I've had it for a few years, the plug doesn't work so stuck using batteries, and it seems to suck up batteries pretty fast. After a while I had issue with it not zeroing out, it would be 0 then go up and down. I didn't need it for accuracy but more for an estimate. Time to toss it. Right now the numbers are bouncing around from -0.7 to 5 oz...
customer_reviews.author: Stephan Floess

customer_reviews.title: Decent Scale
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scale for the money. It functions well and is very accurate. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because of the size of the scale. Yes, it will weigh up to 110 pounds, but placing a box on the scale large enough to have that much weight would be tricky. If you ship small boxes it is great. If you are looking for a scale for larger boxes, this is not the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: MajorDrake

customer_reviews.title: Knocked me off my feet
customer_reviews.text: I love this scale! I use it for epoxy work where I need to constantly measure 1:2 and 1:3. It’s fairly granular and very accurate compare to other scales. The tare functionality works well. Use that to reset between parts so you don’t need to keep doing math in your head. I wish it had one more decimal of accuracy, but switching between ounces and grams is easy enough! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Mackintosh

customer_reviews.title: Great but BEWARE...
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these and I love them. I use one for when I travel. I had to replace the batteries today and guess what... they are specialized batteries that you can ONLY be purchased from overseas - they are AAA Midi Max. Normal, everyday AAA batteries will NOT work in this. So disappointed that they sell a product that corners you into their batteries only.
customer_reviews.author: Susan S

customer_reviews.title: Very good and extremely accurate scale to the 10th of an ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good and extremely accurate scale to the 10th of an ounce. Small but not too small that you can put luggage or large packages on it. I would have given 5 stars but if you are on battery power, it shuts off automatically after 90 seconds, which is good to save the batteries, but bad if you want to weigh out liquids or refrigerants and it shuts off, since when you restart it, it zeroes out. All in all excellent value for decent scale
customer_reviews.author: PerryB

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was a little larger but works great
customer_reviews.text: Scale works great, just wish it was a little larger. The platform only measures about 8x10 so for larger packages you'll need to use a board or something and re-zero. Other than that this thing works great. Very accurate, Every package I've weighed has came in at exactly the same weight from the shippers scales. The remote display comes in very handy when weighing a larger item.
customer_reviews.author: 09RT

customer_reviews.title: Has large bright blue illuminated separate display.  High accuracy.  High weight limit.
customer_reviews.text: The scale has a large bright blue illuminated very easy to read display which is on a control module which is separate from the scale and connected to it by a long coiled cord. This lets one put large items on the scale without blocking one's view of the display. It weighs with an accuracy of 0.1 oz and has a maximum weight capacity of 110 lbs. Very nice and at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: DonPTop Contributor: Quantum Physics

customer_reviews.title: Would buy agaim
customer_reviews.text: Best scales I’ve owned. I ship a lot and these are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda K

customer_reviews.title: Cheap junk. Power cord did not fit tightly
customer_reviews.text: I never got to actually use the scale. I wanted to run it off of power, not batteries. The power cord did not fit tightly enough, so the power wouldn't stay on so I could use the scale. The scale and separate read-out unit seemed very cheap and not durable at all. I returned this scale for a refund and will resume my search for a quality scale with a separate read-out unit. This scale is not it.
customer_reviews.author: Bad quilter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little shipping scale - especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great scale so far. I was concerned about the few negative reviews but I have weighed a few calibration blocks from other scales and this was spot on. Occasionally it will vary +/- 0.1oz for the same item, but that is more than accurate enough for its intended purpose (shipping) It does read pounds and ounces so it is super easy to enter into the computer for shipping. Tare function works as expected as well. It was also a nice touch to include batteries as well as an alternate method to power it. The warranty card says this scale carries a 10 year warranty so that is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AC adaptor non-functional. Scale works otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: It works with the batteries but the AC adaptor won’t power it. I would have returned it but I needed it right then. Other than that, it’s fine. I will say that it doesn’t seem super sturdy but I’m literally just mailing postage so it’s not a concern for me.
customer_reviews.author: Western Sizzlin

customer_reviews.title: Great scale
customer_reviews.text: Been using this scale for 5 years now, or well I just had to buy another one cause it started acting weirdly. Don't let that discourage you though, this is a top notch scale. Very exact - I sell online since many years back and have verified this every time I drop off. Highly recommend this scale despite the fact that I had to buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Henrik

customer_reviews.title: Complete trash.
customer_reviews.text: These scales do not work well. They are inconsistent at best. I have no idea if they are accurate. You can weigh the same item several different times and get a different reading each time. I do, however, believe that one of those readings is indeed correct. Just not sure which one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: better for small to medium sized boxes
customer_reviews.text: Affordable and accurate for small to medium sized items. However it's not so great for a really big heavy box. When the big box sags a little and center of gravity shifts, the scale gives slightly different numbers. I've turned a big box on a different side and gotten a slightly different number. It was confirmed when one of the first big boxes I used it on was rejected at post office for insufficient postage due to it weighing in wrong. My advice is to weigh the huge ones on more than one side, take heaviest weight, and I still round job a bit
customer_reviews.author: G. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Compact and light weight that doesn't have a large footprint
customer_reviews.text: We got this to weigh packages for our small business. The weight is light and small and the display can be move around (useful for larger packages!) The power cord is fairly long which is very handy for positioning. The unit doesn't take up much room, which is critical because our bench space in the workshop is fairly limited.
customer_reviews.author: David Lockwood

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Makes a better boat anchor than a scale.
customer_reviews.text: Scale weight fluctuates up and down sporadically. Even after you Tare it it still goes crazy. Try turning it off and you’re lucky if it turn back on at all. Screen locks up and have to unplug and plug it in multiple times to get it to read anything except all 0 again. Went through 3 of these all with the same problem. Tried to call the company at the number provided on the paperwork and the number doesn’t work. Pretty horrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I doesn't work or weight properly. Not only it doesn't give an accurate weight, but the numbers keep on jumping even a few seconds after the iterm stays on top of the scale. It's so frustrating that the same item weights different each time. This scale is a waste of money. I tried all surfaces, items, and even calibrating and still doesn't work. Meanwhile the returning window closed (1 month) so I am stuck with this unuseful device. Stay away fhis. Don't thrwo your money away
customer_reviews.author: liliana de marquez

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Worst scale I've ever owned. My previous scale to this one lasted almost 5 years. This one literally lasted less than a week. I never returned it due to complications and it is now somewhere in a trash heap. I should have listened to reviews but I figured they had just gotten a bad one. I would highly recommend looking elsewhere for a scale.
customer_reviews.author: Sigel110

customer_reviews.title: Had to replace and no way to contact the company
customer_reviews.text: I had this scale for approx. 2 years. I have used it only a handful of times before the display started acting up. I ordered another one because I tried to figure out how to contact the company for their warranty and can not find the correct way to contact them. This machine has a box that says 10 year warranty and no website or anything to contact the company. I like the ability to have the digital readout away from the scale for doing larger packages. I purchased another one in hopes that it will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Josie S.

customer_reviews.title: Works and is a good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scale for weighing items I've sold online. It's easy to set up and read. Cons are I have 2 of these and one of them and sometimes I have to push the 0.0 button a few times to get it to set to 0.0, it has a habit of drifting between -.02 and .02. Otherwise pretty nice and affordable. The other scales I was interested in were either a lot bigger (I wanted something I could stick in a drawer when not in use) or a lot more money (usually $100+ or more).
customer_reviews.author: Emerald

customer_reviews.title: Top folding cover breaks
customer_reviews.text: I only gave a 1 star review due to the fact that the top cover of the scale that opens and closes broke the very first week of use due to its cheap quality and poor designed tabs. I still use and just can't open it up anymore without the foldable cover falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Anna and Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipper! Accurate on weights.Great price ! Amazon Prime free shipping !
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't believe how accurate it is. For the price this worked great for measuring how much refrigerant to put in ,by the ounces! Some refrigeration is down to the ounce for proper charge and weight.Dislike memory not good and in average bright light hard to read display, but for less than 40 dollars what do you expect ? Well it worked almost as good as the ones you buy HARV suppliers
customer_reviews.author: Emptysky1

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: I've used this scale since November 2018. Its serves a purpose for those just starting out. My advice is to invest in a nicer one if you can. If you are someone who is hard on things, THIS IS NOT THE ONE FOR YOU.
customer_reviews.author: Reed Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Worked less than 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for less than 5 months. I do not ship that often. Once or twice per month, and already stopped working properly. It looks the connecting cable from the scale to the reader has issues. It turns on, but it is not reading. It states 10 yrs warranty, but can not find any info on the company.
customer_reviews.author: pr_littlemermaid

customer_reviews.title: Good Value!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this one after I read the reviews on the product which were talking about the easiness of reading the scale. It was true! Even though it is a small size itself, it is very convenient to use because it has lone line attached to small reading monitor that you can position away from the box you would be measuring. Also, it was pretty accurate when I measured the weights of boxes with this and when I did it again at UPS stores. It's been just a couple of months since I purchased it, but I am pretty sure this was a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jun  Hemingway

customer_reviews.title: Died Quick
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 3 years, maybe weighed 100 objects in that time, (just light personal ebay stuff.) it no longer turns on so it's in the trash. I imagine it would last only a few weeks in a more active environment, definitely buying something else this time.
customer_reviews.author: John Z

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate weight.
customer_reviews.text: I do FBA, typically 40-48lb boxes. This scale is off by 2-3 lbs every time I go to UPS. Sad that my bathroom scale is more accurate. While the size is described, my 12x16 boxes are too big for the platform. The fold out trays do not lay flat, seems more for a bag if items. So, guess I’ll pay up for a larger scale.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great scales with battery and plug-in power.  Black plates break easily but otherwise they're great.
customer_reviews.text: I own three of these and they all work great. Being able to use batteries is a huge deal for my trade show based business. You can also plug the scales in if need be. My only complaint is that the black flip-up plastic plates are flimsy and break easily at the hinge. I pretty much just don't use them and lay things only on top of the scale without the black plates flipped up. Two of my three have broken plastic plates and we are not rough with these things. But overall, these have been great for my business.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Great scale!
customer_reviews.text: Best scale I’ve bought in a long time! I Love that the screen isn’t attached to the scale. I constantly had big packages and couldn’t read the weight and had to attempt to find the hold button because the package overlapped the screen. With this scale I definitely do not have that problem! Great scale for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Riana Green

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Super accurate and easy to use. The display is a little hard to read unless it’s angled just right. My only suggestions is to improve the display, maybe something other than the blue would fix it. Also expand the scale platform size to better hold larger boxes. I bought this for its accuracy and it is in fact accurate. I would recommend this scale based on the accuracy factor alone.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING scale!!
customer_reviews.text: Super great scale, especially for the price! Set up was very simple, and it comes already calibrated for use right out of the box. The fact that it also comes with the AA batteries it requires for using without the cord was a pleasant surprise, too. And I LOVE the stretchy cord between the base and scale faceplate, to allow flexibility when weighing bulky objects. It does not have the ability to pass info along via USB, but honestly it's not a feature I've really missed, either.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after a year
customer_reviews.text: The scale worked perfect for a year, but after that it stopped showing accurate weights. The weight keeps going up and down on the scale and it won't even stay set at zero. Seller advised us to stop using the plug in adapter, but that did not resolve the problem. New batteries don't fix the problem either, so we are now having to purchase a new scale and use our postal scale in the meantime. If you purchase, be prepared to buy a new one after a year of use.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Nice value!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to use in work area to figure out shipping weights instead of the kitchen scale I had been using. This was the lowest priced scale I could find that had the screen separate. Came with an AC power cord and batteries. Seems very accurate. Nice quality. Cord that attaches screen to scale is removable and is like a telephone cord.
customer_reviews.author: AbbyNNK

customer_reviews.title: Battery compartment too small for batteries!
customer_reviews.text: Battery compartment too small for batteries, and the cord is too short. When construction specs are incorrect on a measuring device I can`t trust it for any purpose other than a paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: liljim4500

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I have a certified kitchen and need accurate weight measurements. I had a large, heavy scale that had to be replaced, and this is what we went with. It is fairly lightweight and weighs ingredients so much more accurately. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Green-eyed Rose

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home shipping
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use, compact, and love the fact that the readout can move, so you can see the measurement around oddly-sized and oversized packages. Exactly what I needed. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: KTS

customer_reviews.title: broke after 1 year with less than 100 times use.
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT THIS ON 4/10/2017, barely used probably under 100 times, now it is no longer working properly, number keep jumping and never stop, when it worked , it was good, but now its just a pile of junk
customer_reviews.author: chim cánh cut

customer_reviews.title: Good overall, timeout is problematic
customer_reviews.text: Accurate scale with resolution of about 1oz or 30g. Problem is the 90 second timeout as it shuts down and doesn't memorize the tare. Frustrating when weight is slowly added or removed as it loses tare. Alternative is to not use tare and instead write down the starting weight and do the math.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Works well, looks good
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to "assemble", easy to use, and looks good. Surprisingly, I had a few issues with 2 different brands of scales I purchased before this one. It's probably more relief than anything that I'm writing this review, but I wanted to give it 5 stars for getting it right. It's just nice when stuff works.
customer_reviews.author: zal1093

product_meta.title: Accuteck ShipPro 110lbs x 0.1 oz. Digital Shipping Postal Scale, Black (W-8580-110-Black)
product_meta.description: Size:1 PackAccuteck ShipPro W-8580 110lbs x 0.1 oz. Black Digital shipping postal scale Accuteck ShipPro-Ship Professionally, Start Professionally Here comes New 2014 Accuteck ShipPro series with new and amazing features. Have bulky and large size packages? Accuteck ShipPro Series comes with the extended large backlit energy-saving display (cable approximately 18inches).Have tube-shaped packages? Accuteck ShipPro Series comes with two way sided fold up mailer holders. Use it either way, either side. Have light or heavy packages? Accuteck ShipPro Series comes with two weighing capacity choices of 60lb, 110lb depending on your needs. Start Weight from 10g/0.5oz.Have concerns about the accuracy? Accuteck ShipPro has a graduation of 0.1oz.Have worries about the batteries expenses? Accuteck ShipPro can be powered by batteries, USB cable, and Ac adapter. All included. Save money on batteries by using USB cable or Ac adapter though we provide a free set of batteries. Have a specific color wanted? Accuteck ShipPro offers color choices of: Black and Gray now. Let us know if you want any specific color. We will try to make it. Have a new business and have a tight budget? Accuteck ShipPro Series gives you a most competitive price. 10 Year Limited Warranty
feature_bullets: Data cannot be transfered through USB cable
Extended cord with Large Backlit energy saving display; Has Hold, Tare function
Newest technology for easy calibration. Two way sided fold up mailer holder
Can Be powered by batteries, USB cable or Ac adapter. (All Included). Dimensions : 10 x 8 x 3 inches.
Capacity: 110 lb. capacity; Accuracy: 0.1oz, Reading Modes: Pounds/ounces, ounces, kilograms/grams, grams

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars4,016 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
